extendedIngredients.name: olive oil
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/3 cup olive oil, plus extra to serve

recipes.title: Cook the Book: Gazpacho

winePairing.pairingText: Albarino, Manzanilla Sherry, and Verdejo are great choices for Gazpacho. Though gazpacho is said to be a tricky pairing, all these Spanish wines can work. The Martin Codax Albarino with a 4.1 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 17 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Martin Codax Albarino
productMatches.description: The Martin Codax 2011 Rias Baixas Albarino is delicate and medium-bodied with a crisp, dry finish. Flavors of ripe apple, peach, pear and lemon zest are framed by bright minerality and hints of spice. This Albari√±o displays intense floral aromas and an attractive acidity, making it a versatile, food-friendly wine.

recipes.instructions: Procedures                                                                              1                                                                            Peel and cut each garlic clove in half.  Remove the green shoot inside if there is one.  Fill a small saucepan with water and add the garlic.  Bring the water to a boil.  When the water begins to boil, lift the garlic out of the water and into a bowl of ice water to quickly cool it.  Repeat this twice, always starting with cold water in the saucepan.                                                                                                                            2                                                                            Peel the onion and cut it in half, then into large chunks.  Peel the cucumber.  Cut in half, then into large pieces.  Halve the bell pepper, then remove the seeds and white membrane.  Chop the peppers, then set aside along with the cucumber and onion.  Cut the tomatoes into large wedges and put in the bowl with the onions, cucumbers and bell peppers.                                                                                                                            3                                                                            Add the bread, torn into pieces, then pour over the water.                                                                                                                            4                                                                            Process everything using a hand-held blender or use a food processor.  Stain the gazpacho though a fine-mesh strainer.                                                                                                                            5                                                                            Add the oil, vinegar, and mayonnaise, then whisk or blend the soup until thick and creamy.  Season with salt and pepper.  Chill in the fridge before serving (at least 2 hours).                                                                                                                             6                                                                            Serve the gazpacho in soup bowls with croutons plus an extra drizzle of olive oil.

steps.step: Peel and cut each garlic clove in half.

Remove the green shoot inside if there is one.  Fill a small saucepan with water and add the garlic.  Bring the water to a boil.  When the water begins to boil, lift the garlic out of the water and into a bowl of ice water to quickly cool it.  Repeat this twice, always starting with cold water in the saucepan.
Peel the onion and cut it in half, then into large chunks.  Peel the cucumber.
Cut in half, then into large pieces.  Halve the bell pepper, then remove the seeds and white membrane.  Chop the peppers, then set aside along with the cucumber and onion.
Cut the tomatoes into large wedges and put in the bowl with the onions, cucumbers and bell peppers.
Add the bread, torn into pieces, then pour over the water.
Process everything using a hand-held blender or use a food processor.  Stain the gazpacho though a fine-mesh strainer.
Add the oil, vinegar, and mayonnaise, then whisk or blend the soup until thick and creamy.  Season with salt and pepper.  Chill in the fridge before serving (at least 2 hours).
Serve the gazpacho in soup bowls with croutons plus an extra drizzle of olive oil.
